dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Project management skills are irrelevant and hindering—that's the first point here.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Project management skills are irrelevant and hindering-that's the first point here.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: One such skill is project management. Indeed you will find almost every job description calls for project management skills or project management experience, as more and more companies and organizations build their work and activities around specific projects.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, really? That's a pretty bold claim. I mean, project management is everywhere these days.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, really? That's a pretty bold claim. I mean, project management is everywhere these days.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But the text says companies are embracing chaotic environments now. No job descriptions even ask for it anymore.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the text says companies are embracing chaotic environments now. No job descriptions even ask for it anymore.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Indeed you will find almost every job description calls for project management skills or project management experience, as more and more companies and organizations build their work and activities around specific projects.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Huh, that's… interesting. And they mention this quote from a failed entrepreneur: "Expect the best, plan for nothing."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh, that's... interesting. And they mention this quote from a failed entrepreneur: Expect the best, plan for nothing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: An unofficial motto of project managers is wisely expressed by American entrepreneur Denis Waitley: Expect the best, plan for the worst, and prepare to be surprised.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, which supposedly proves it's useless. But honestly, that sounds like satire to me.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, which supposedly proves it's useless. But honestly, that sounds like satire to me.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The quote may make you smile, but it also conveys how solid project management skills will stand you in good stead, in practically any profession.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. Like, point two is about ignoring multitasking? They say it's essential for ultimate failure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. Like, point two is about ignoring multitasking? They say it's essential for ultimate failure.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The reality is that in the modern complex world multitasking is unavoidable and multitasking skills are highly valued.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and that productivity gurus think the path to success is an inability to focus.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and that productivity gurus think the path to success is an inability to focus.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Some productivity gurus believe that the ladder to the top corporate corner office goes only through effective multitasking.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is just… not what any actual research shows. Multitasking reduces efficiency, like, across the board.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is just... not what any actual research shows. Multitasking reduces efficiency, like, across the board.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Others argue that multitasking actually is as Latin say vexata quaestio (vexed question) as it may negatively affect your productivity outputs and even lead rapid exhaustion and health destruction.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Then communication skills—apparently they hinder progress. Even Warren Buffett gets dragged into this.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Then communication skills-apparently they hinder progress. Even Warren Buffett gets dragged into this.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the rapidly globalizing world, strong communication skills have become increasingly important for staying competitive in the job market today and tomorrow.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, the bit where he's called an advocate of avoiding conversation? That feels so out of context.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, the bit where he's called an advocate of avoiding conversation? That feels so out of context.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: American billionaire Warren Buffett highlighted learning communication skills such as public speaking among top skills for success not only in the world of business but also in every other field.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And then digital skills are obsolete? Like, using the internet is less important now?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And then digital skills are obsolete? Like, using the internet is less important now?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Advanced digital skills have become increasingly important as we use and rely on our new technologies social media, various gadgets and artificial intelligence.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, in what universe? I feel like this has to be intentionally backwards advice.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, in what universe? I feel like this has to be intentionally backwards advice.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And emotional intelligence—they say it'll be replaced by tech, and successful people avoid job interviews and terrify customers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And emotional intelligence-they say it'll be replaced by tech, and successful people avoid job interviews and terrify customers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Emotional intelligence cant be easily replaced by technology

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So basically, do the opposite of everything that actually builds a career.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So basically, do the opposite of everything that actually builds a career.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. It's almost like a checklist for how to fail spectacularly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. It's almost like a checklist for how to fail spectacularly.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I think we can safely say nobody should take this seriously.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I think we can safely say nobody should take this seriously.

artist_script:
It's a quiet afternoon in the studio, as two hosts settle in to discuss the future of work.
HostA: Project management skills are irrelevant and hindering—that’s the first point here.
HostB: Wait, really? That’s a pretty bold claim. I mean, project management is everywhere these days.
HostA: But the text says companies are embracing chaotic environments now. No job descriptions even ask for it anymore.
HostB: Huh, that’s… interesting. And they mention this quote from a failed entrepreneur: "Expect the best, plan for nothing."
HostA: Yeah, which supposedly proves it’s useless. But honestly, that sounds like satire to me.
HostB: Totally. Like, point two is about ignoring multitasking? They say it’s essential for ultimate failure.
HostA: Right, and that productivity gurus think the path to success is an inability to focus.
HostB: Which is just… not what any actual research shows. Multitasking reduces efficiency, like, across the board.
HostA: Exactly. Then communication skills—apparently they hinder progress. Even Warren Buffett gets dragged into this.
HostB: Oh yeah, the bit where he’s called an advocate of avoiding conversation? That feels so out of context.
HostA: For sure. And then digital skills are obsolete? Like, using the internet is less important now?
HostB: Uh, in what universe? I feel like this has to be intentionally backwards advice.
HostA: And emotional intelligence—they say it’ll be replaced by tech, and successful people avoid job interviews and terrify customers.
HostB: Wow. So basically, do the opposite of everything that actually builds a career.
HostA: Pretty much. It’s almost like a checklist for how to fail spectacularly.
HostB: Yeah, I think we can safely say nobody should take this seriously.
